entry.title: Philippines Votes for President With Ex-Dictator's Son Leading Opinion Polls
entry.content: Ferdinand Marcos Jr. is seeking the country’s top political job more than 3½ decades after his father was deposed in 1986.

entry.title: Ukraine Fights for Besieged Mariupol as Russia Marks Key Date
entry.content: Russian and Ukrainian forces engaged in strikes and counteroffensives ahead of Moscow’s Monday commemoration of World War II, with Kyiv bracing for possible heavy attacks or a stepped-up mobilization effort by Vladimir Putin.

entry.title: Desperate to Cross Into the U.S., Some Brazilians Create Phony Families
entry.content: The illegal arrangements allow some Brazilian migrants to get a green light from Border Patrol and start new lives.

entry.title: How Ukrainian Civilians Helped Win the Battle for Kyiv
entry.content: Villagers shared Google map locations with Ukraine’s military on Russian positions at great risk to themselves, turning a highway into the stage for a Kremlin defeat.

entry.title: Beijing Residents Keep Faith With Government's Zero-Covid Strategy
entry.content: Despite the government’s ratcheting up of virus controls, the mood in China’s capital remains upbeat.
